result.execSummary:
All charges against Allen Gene Mc Cuen in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Allen Gene Mc Cuen is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Allen Gene Mc Cuen

records.addlTxt: 11:36 AM Defendant Allen Gene Mc Cuen appeared by zoom.  Attorney Philip A. Helgeson in court for Allen Gene Mc Cuen.  Attorney Kaley Walker in court for State of Wisconsin. 22CF115, 22CF94. ADA Walker: guilty to Ct#1 in 22CF15 impose 10 years prison- 5 years IC and 5 years ES stayed w/3 years probation: successful completion of treatment court, $3323.17 restitution  joint/several with Melissa Teegarden, court costs ($518). Dismiss Ct#2 in 22CF15 and 22CF94. Atty Helgeson and Def agree. Court goes over Def's right to personal appearance; Def waives that right and wishes to proceed via zoom. Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def -Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights. Defendant understands charges, penalties and constitutional rights. Def pleas guilty to Ct#1 in 22CF15. Counsel stipulates to factual basis for plea.  Court finds a factual basis to accept the plea.  Court finds Defendant is freely, voluntarily and knowingly making plea and waiving constitutional rights. Court finds defendant guilty to Ct#1 in 22CF15. Court dismisses Ct#2 in 22CF15 and 22CF94. ADA Walker and Atty Helgeson address sentencing- joint recommendation. Victim's rights are in compliance. Defendant addresses the court.  Court imposes 10 years prison- 5 years initial incarceration  w/ 5 years ES, stayed, orders 3 years probation; concurrent to current probation- court costs ($518). restitution $3323.17 w/ 10% surcharge joint/several with Melissa Teegarden, successful completion of treatment court, Comply with any programming as recommended by the COMPAS assessment and/or Department of Corrections. 120 days conditional jail- stayed to be used at the agent and/or treatment court's discretion. Provide DNA sample within 30 days. 0 days credit if probation is revoked. Eligible for the CIP and SAP immediately but cannot be released until 75% of sentence has been completed. Appeal rights are given to the defendant.  11:58
filed by ADA Kaley Walker. eif
Status conference on August 15, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Information filed with the Court. DE waives further reading of the Information. NG. Court adjourned at 11:05 am.
filed by ADA Kaley Walker. eif

11:00 AM Defendant Allen Gene Mc Cuen appears in custody from Jail via video, Atty Liesl E. Nelson, ADA Kaley Walker appears for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews the Waiver of PH w/DE. Court finds DE freely, intelligently and knowingly waives constitutional right to a PH.  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DE probably committed a felony. Court binds DE over for further proceedings.  Status conference scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 11:30 am.
from Ct Comm Gavic to Remote Appearance Request "Based upon the representation of defense counsel, the remote appearance is granted. JRG"
Request to appear remotely- Defendant  filed by Atty Nelson

records.addlTxt: Court finds Defendant freely, intelligently, knowingly, and understandingly made and waives constitutional right to those time requirements.
records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on June 21, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant to maintain Absolute Sobriety.
NO CONTACT WHATSOEVER WITH A.R.P.

3:18 PM Defendant Allen Gene Mc Cuen appears in custody from Jail via video, Atty Liesl E. Nelson appears by phone, ADA Joseph M. Schieffer appears for the State of Wisconsin.  Court informs Defendant of charges, and possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Waives reading. Court reviews DE's rights. ADA Schieffer is requesting a $10,000.00 SIBS  w/conditions of AS & NC w/A.R.P,, no objection. Court so orders.  DE does qualify for PD. Court confirms address and phone number. DE to report to Mary Kelly's office as soon as he is released. Court adjourned at 3:26 pm.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 11:00 am.
